p: Diarrhea is a condition of increased secretion, volume, fluidity, and frequency of bowel movements, thus causing loss of electrolytes and water. An ethanol extract of H. pubescens seeds when tested on castor oil-induced diarrhea in rats is reported to cause a significant increase in the feces dry weight, and reduced defecation. At a dosage of 200 and 400 mg/kg BW, a significant reduction ( p < 0.05) of castor oil-induced diarrhea is observed [ 114] ( Table 4).
